metadata.subject: Re: and....another bit of advice ...? on WA

relationships.description: Lisa is seeking advice from Jeffrey about obtaining permission to use Woody Allen footage
Lisa taped footage with Woody Allen but needs legal permission to use it
Lisa has taped or scheduled tapings with numerous politicians, journalists, and celebrities for her projects

analysis.purpose: To seek Jeffrey E.'s advice on obtaining permission to use Woody Allen footage for an online course and potential TV episode
analysis.significance: Reveals extensive network of high-profile individuals who have participated in Lisa New's academic projects, and shows Jeffrey E.'s role in facilitating access to prominent figures

concerns: Woody Allen's legal team has prohibited use of filmed footage
Copyright and release permissions needed for academic/broadcast use

notable_quotes: Woody Allen's legal team said that we couldn't use the film we shot of him: online, for broadcast, anywhere.
It was a fantastic experience taping with him and so, even if I can't ever use the footage, I'm still grateful to you for making the day possible.
politicians I have taped: Bill Clinton, Al Gore, John McCain, Mayor Rahm Emanuel, Mayor Tom Menino, Supreme Court Justice Elena Kagan...
red_flags: Extensive list of high-profile political and media figures being 'taped'
Unclear context for why Jeffrey E. has access to facilitate these recordings

blackmail_indicators.description: The term 'taped' appears to refer to legitimate academic interviews and recordings for an online course, not covert recordings for compromising purposes

illegal_activity.description: Document discusses legitimate academic work seeking proper permissions for media usage

details: References to journalists Katie Couric, David Brooks, and Andrea Mitchell who have been taped
Mentions potential TV episode from the Woody Allen conversation
Discusses media usage rights and permissions

public_knowledge.context: Reveals behind-the-scenes academic projects involving numerous high-profile figures, which could be of media interest given Jeffrey Epstein's associations

analysis.summary: Lisa New, a Harvard professor, emails Jeffrey E. seeking advice on obtaining permission to use Woody Allen footage for her online course, while listing numerous high-profile politicians, journalists, and celebrities she has recorded for her academic projects, demonstrating Jeffrey E.'s role in facilitating access to prominent figures.
